required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Alogliptin Used in Combination With Sulfonylurea in Participants With Type 2 Diabetes in Japan
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2/3, Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel-Group, Multicenter Study to Determine the Efficacy and Safety of SYR-322 When Used in Combination With Sulfonylurea in Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes in Japan

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was evaluate the efficacy and safety of alogliptin, once daily (QD) combined with an Sulfonylurea taken QD or twice daily (BID) in type 2 diabetic patients with uncontrolled blood glucose.

detailed_description.textblock:
Both insulin hyposecretion and insulin-resistance are considered to be involved in the development of type 2 diabetes mellitus.
Takeda is developing SYR-322 (alogliptin) for the improvement of glycemic control in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus. Alogliptin is an inhibitor of the dipeptidyl peptidase IV (DPP-IV) enzyme. DPP-IV is thought to be primarily responsible for the degradation of 2 peptide hormones released in response to nutrient ingestion. It is expected that inhibition of DPP-IV will improve glycemic control in patients with type 2 diabetes.
The present study was planned to evaluate the efficacy and safety of alogliptin as an add-on to sulfonylurea in type 2 diabetic patients who had uncontrolled blood glucose despite treatment with an sulfonylurea as well as diet and exercise therapies.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Glycosylated Hemoglobin (Week 12).
primary_outcome.description: The change in the value of glycosylated hemoglobin (the concentration of glucose bound to hemoglobin as a percent of the absolute maximum that can be bound) collected at week 12 or final visit and glycosylated hemoglobin collected at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Glycosylated Hemoglobin (Week 2).
secondary_outcome.description: The change in the value of glycosylated hemoglobin (the concentration of glucose bound to hemoglobin as a percent of the absolute maximum that can be bound) collected at week 2 and glycosylated hemoglobin collected at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Glycosylated Hemoglobin (Week 4).
secondary_outcome.description: The change in the value of glycosylated hemoglobin (the concentration of glucose bound to hemoglobin as a percent of the absolute maximum that can be bound) collected at week 4 and glycosylated hemoglobin collected at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Glycosylated Hemoglobin (Week 8).
secondary_outcome.description: The change in the value of glycosylated hemoglobin (the concentration of glucose bound to hemoglobin as a percent of the absolute maximum that can be bound) collected at week 8 and glycosylated hemoglobin collected at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting Plasma Glucose (Week 2).
secondary_outcome.description: The change between the value of fasting plasma glucose collected at week 2 and baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting Plasma Glucose (Week 4).
secondary_outcome.description: The change between the value of fasting plasma glucose collected at week 4 and baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting Plasma Glucose (Week 8).
secondary_outcome.description: The change between the value of fasting plasma glucose collected at week 8 and baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Fasting Plasma Glucose (Week 12).
secondary_outcome.description: The change between the value of fasting plasma glucose collected at week 12 or final visit and baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Blood Glucose Measured by the Meal Tolerance Test (Week 12).
secondary_outcome.description: The change between the value of blood glucose measured by the meal tolerance test collected at week 12 or final visit and blood glucose measured by the meal tolerance test collected at baseline. Meal tolerance test measures blood glucose through blood samples drawn before a meal and at 2 hours after the start of the meal.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Alogliptin 12.5 mg QD and Glimepiride QD or BID
Alogliptin 25 mg QD and Glimepiride QD or BID
Glimepiride 1, 2, 3 or 4 mg QD or BID

intervention.description: Alogliptin 12.5 mg, tablets, orally, once daily and glimepiride 1, 2, 3 or 4 mg, tablets, orally, once or twice daily for up 12 weeks.
intervention.arm_group_label: Alogliptin 12.5 mg QD and Glimepiride QD or BID

intervention.description: Alogliptin 25 mg, tablets, orally, once daily and glimepiride 1, 2, 3 or 4 mg, tablets, orally, once or twice daily for up 12 weeks.
intervention.arm_group_label: Alogliptin 25 mg QD and Glimepiride QD or BID

intervention.description: Glimepiride 1, 2, 3 or 4 mg, tablets, orally, once or twice daily and alogliptin placebo-matching tablets, orally, once daily for up 12 weeks.
intervention.arm_group_label: Glimepiride 1, 2, 3 or 4 mg QD or BID

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Had been taking a sulfonylurea for at least 4 weeks prior to the initiation of the observation period (Week -12).
2. Had been taking glimepiride at a stable dose regimen (1, 2, 3 or 4 mg/day, once or twice daily in the morning or in the morning and evening, before or after meal) for at least 12 weeks prior to the initiation of the treatment period (Week 0).
3. Had glycosylated hemoglobin (HbA1c) of 7.0% or more and below 10.0% at 8 weeks after the initiation of the observation period (Week -4).
4. Had an HbA1c difference between 4 weeks after the initiation of the observation period (Week -8) and 8 weeks after the initiation of the observation period (Week -4) being within 10.0%* of the value at 4 weeks after the initiation of the observation period (Week -8) (*rounded off to the first decimal place).
5. Was receiving specific diet and exercise (if any) therapies during the observation period.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Had taken other diabetic medications than glimepiride within 12 weeks before the initiation of the treatment period (Week 0).

overall_official.last_name: Professor, Professor, Diabetes and Endocrine Division
overall_official.affiliation: Department of Medicine, Kawasaki Medical School

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants enrolled at 33 investigative sites in Japan from 20 August 2008 to 18 April 2009.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants with a historical diagnosis of type 2 diabetes mellitus with uncontrolled blood glucose despite treatment with sulfonylurea as well as diet and exercise therapies were enrolled in one of 3, once-daily (QD) or twice daily (BID) treatment groups.

group.title: Alogliptin 12.5 mg QD and Glimepiride QD or BID
group.description: Alogliptin 12.5 mg, tablets, orally, once daily and glimepiride 1, 2, 3 or 4 mg, tablets, orally, once or twice daily for up 12 weeks.

group.title: Alogliptin 25 mg QD and Glimepiride QD or BID
group.description: Alogliptin 25 mg, tablets, orally, once daily and glimepiride 1, 2, 3 or 4 mg, tablets, orally, once or twice daily for up 12 weeks.

group.title: Glimepiride 1, 2, 3 or 4 mg QD or BID
group.description: Glimepiride 1, 2, 3 or 4 mg, tablets, orally, once or twice daily and alogliptin placebo-matching tablets, orally, once daily for up 12 weeks.

group.title: Alogliptin 12.5 mg QD and Glimepiride QD or BID
group.description: Alogliptin 12.5 mg, tablets, orally, once daily and glimepiride 1, 2, 3 or 4 mg, tablets, orally, once or twice daily for up 12 weeks.

group.title: Alogliptin 25 mg QD and Glimepiride QD or BID
group.description: Alogliptin 25 mg, tablets, orally, once daily and glimepiride 1, 2, 3 or 4 mg, tablets, orally, once or twice daily for up 12 weeks.

group.title: Glimepiride 1, 2, 3 or 4 mg QD or BID
group.description: Glimepiride 1, 2, 3 or 4 mg, tablets, orally, once or twice daily and alogliptin placebo-matching tablets, orally, once daily for up 12 weeks.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Glycosylated Hemoglobin (Week 12).
outcome.description: The change in the value of glycosylated hemoglobin (the concentration of glucose bound to hemoglobin as a percent of the absolute maximum that can be bound) collected at week 12 or final visit and glycosylated hemoglobin collected at baseline.
outcome.population: Analysis based on last observation carried forward, where the last postbaseline double-blind observed value is carried forward and used for all subsequent scheduled time points where data is missing. Values are from the Full Analysis Set.

reported_events.time_frame: Treatment-emergent adverse events are adverse events that started after the first dose of study drug and the last dose of study drug.
reported_events.desc: At each visit the investigator had to document any occurrence of adverse events and abnormal laboratory findings. Any event spontaneously reported by the participant or observed by the investigator was recorded, irrespective of the relation to study treatment.

group.title: Alogliptin 12.5 mg QD and Glimepiride QD or BID
group.description: Alogliptin 12.5 mg, tablets, orally, once daily and glimepiride 1, 2, 3 or 4 mg, tablets, orally, once or twice daily for up 12 weeks.

group.title: Glimepiride 1, 2, 3 or 4 mg QD or BID
group.description: Glimepiride 1, 2, 3 or 4 mg, tablets, orally, once or twice daily and alogliptin placebo-matching tablets, orally, once daily for up 12 weeks.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The clinical trial contract states that information should never be disclosed without prior consent of the sponsor, although it does not specify the number of days during which disclosure of information is limited.

point_of_contact.organization: Japan Development Center, Pharmaceutical Development Division
